q: Committee. Kirsten Gillibrand was recently elected to the Senate seat she was appointed to in 2009 and had sought the committee assignment. She has worked on military issues such as the repeal of the don't ask, don't tell policy for gay troops. And Kirsten Gillibrand served on the House Armed Services Committee when she represented an upstate New York congressional district. And the folks down there have done and are doing an excellent job'': The heartbreaking thing with respect to GuantÃ¡namo is not that there is anything wrong with that; it is one of the finest prison systems in the world. What is awkward is the fact that for whatever reason the Administration was incapable of persuading people that that was a first-class operation, that they were not torturing people, they were not hurting people. And it was then and it is today, a fine operation.
